headline: Dollar Falls to Lowest Since 2023 as Investors Eye Trade Risks

headline: 50 Largest U.S. Banks By Total Assets, Q1 2025
summary: The US banking industry reported a sequential asset increase of 1.8% in the first quarter as banks stockpiled cash and equivalents amid sluggish loan growth.

headline: Big Banks Explore Venturing Into Crypto World Together With Joint Stablecoin
summary: Discussions involve companies co-owned by JPMorgan and others, as lenders brace for the possibility that stablecoins could siphon away deposits and transactions.

headline: Dillard’s, Inc. (DDS) Sues Wells Fargo Over Co-Branded Card Relationship
summary: Dillard’s, Inc. (NYSE:DDS) has filed a lawsuit against Wells Fargo & Company, alleging the bank repeatedly breached its now-terminated co-branded credit card partnership, resulting in tens of millions of dollars in losses for the department store chain. In a heavily redacted complaint submitted to Manhattan federal court, DDS claimed Wells Fargo became an “unwilling and […]
